definitions.definition: To move in an upward direction; to ascend or climb.
definitions.example: I'm having difficulty getting up the stairs.

definitions.definition: To rise from one's bed (often implying to wake up).
definitions.example: I didn't get up until midday.

definitions.definition: To move from a sitting or lying position to a standing position; to stand up.
definitions.example: Get up off the couch and clean this mess!
As dusk fell a storm got up.
The general got up a large body of men.

definitions.definition: To gather or grow larger by accretion.
definitions.example: I could see that he was getting up a temper.

definitions.definition: To go towards the attacking goal.

definitions.example: He got up me about the mess I made in the kitchen.

definitions.definition: To dress in a certain way, especially extravagantly.
definitions.example: She was all got up in the most ridiculous frilly dress.
